revision.text:
The '''Lučenec-Košice Depression''' (in [[Slovak language|Slovak]], ''Lučensko-košická zníženina'') is a geological feature on the border of Slovakia and northeastern Hungary.
The basin is considered part of the [[Inner Western Carpathians]]. Broadly it separates the [[Slovak Ore Mountains]] on the north from the [[North Hungarian Mountains]] on the south.
The basin consists of:
* the [[Southern Slovak Basin]] (SK: ''Juhoslovenská kotlina'') + [[Central Ipoly Basin]] (HU: ''Középsö-Ipoly-medence'') + [[Borsod Hills]] (HU: ''Borsodi-dombság'') * the [[Bodva Hills]] (SK: ''Bodvianska pahorkatina'') * the [[Košice Basin]] (SK: ''Košická kotlina'') + [[Hernád-Valley Basin]] (HU: ''Hernádvölgy-medence'')
{{Carpathian Mountains}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Lucenec-Kosice Depression}} [[Category:Western Carpathians]]
